citation: Proclamation under the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the Roads and Jetties Act 1935

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, by this my proclamation made under section 7 of the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 â€“

        (a) declare that the portion of road specified in Schedule 1 to this proclamation ceases to be a State highway for the purposes of Part II of that Act; and
        (b) declare that the Blow Hole Tourist Road, the Tasmans Arch Tourist Road and the tourist road specified in Schedule 3 to the proclamation notified in the Gazette as Statutory Rules 1993, No. 115 cease to be subsidiary roads for the purposes of Part II of that Act; and
        (c) declare that the portion of road specified in Schedule 2 to this proclamation ceases to be a subsidiary road for the purposes of Part II of that Act; and
        (d) amend the proclamation notified in the Gazette as Statutory Rules 1970, No. 67 as follows:
                (i) by omitting from the first schedule to that proclamation the item relating to the Arthur Highway and substituting the following item:
                Arthur Highway  From the Tasman Highway at the junction of Gordon Street and Cole Street, Sorell to the junction with Stewarts Bay Road, Port Arthur via Forcett, Copping, Dunalley, Eaglehawk Neck, Taranna and Oakwood  69.22
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                
                    (ii) by omitting from Part II of the second schedule to that proclamation the item relating to the Nubeena Secondary Road and substituting the following item:
                    Nubeena Secondary Road  From the Arthur Highway at a point 0.14 kilometres south of the Allans Creek Bridge, Taranna to the junction with Littles Road near Premaydena, via Koonya and Premaydena  12.16
                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                    
                        (iii) by omitting from Part III of the second schedule to that proclamation the items relating to the Blow Hole Tourist Road and the Tasmans Arch Tourist Road; and
                (e) revoke the proclamations notified in the Gazette as Statutory Rules 1982, No. 170 and Statutory Rules 1993, No. 115; and
                (f) declare that this proclamation takes effect on 30 June 1998.
        1 June 1998

        G. S. M. GREEN

        Governor

        By His Excellency's Command,

        T. JOHN CLEARY

        Minister for Transport

        SCHEDULE 1 - Portion of road ceasing to be a state highway

        Definition  Length in kilometres  Arthur Highway    From the junction with Stewarts Bay Road to and including the junction with Safety Cove Road, Port Arthur  1.02
                                                                                                                                                                           
        

        SCHEDULE 2 - Portion of road ceasing to be a subsidiary road

        Definition  Length in kilometres  Nubeena Secondary Road    From the junction with Littles Road near Premaydena to the junction with Safety Cove Road, Port Arthur, via Nubeena  15.22
                                                                                                                                                                                              
        

        Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

        Notified in the Gazette on 10 June 1998

        This proclamation is administered in the Department of Transport.
